@MikeBeall8 @UAkronPresident @MikeBeall8  Hi Mike. We are so sorry to see your room so hot! It takes time for our systems to switch from heat to air, especially in large buildings, and Ohio weather doesn't make it easy. We realize that doesn't make your room any cooler , but wanted you to know we hear you.

@Keldeo7923 @Keldeo7923 Hi Steven. We understand! It takes time for our systems to switch from heat to air, especially in large buildings, and Ohio weather doesn't make it easy (40 degrees one day and 80 the next). Hang in there!

@theactualBBT @theactualBBT Hi Trent. We understand - the social media team is hot too! It takes time for our systems to switch from heat to air, especially in large buildings, and Ohio weather doesn't make it easy (40 degrees one day and 80 the next).

@tjhudy12 @tjhudy12 Hi Tyler. We definitely understand. It takes time for our systems to switch from heat to air, and Ohio weather doesn't make it easy (40 degrees one day and 80 the next). We encourage you to dress in layers this time of the year so you can adjust to each building.

The Akron Water Department has issued a precautionary boil water advisory for selected buildings within the UA campus. The reason for the advisory is due to the unexpected failure and inoperability of a 16â€ water line valve which was discovered during planned work on campus.

As a precaution, and in accordance with EPA regulations, those within these buildings are advised to boil their water until further notice. Water used for drinking/cooking should be brought to a full boil for a minimum of 2 minutes and returned to proper temperature before use.

The buildings under advisory include the Buckingham Building, College of Business Building, Akron Engineering Research Center, Gas Turbine Building, Express Building and Whitby Hall. 

This advisory will be in effect until further notice, but for a minimum of 24 hours.
